abstract: Eight Major League Baseball players, four of them defectors from Cuba, participate in good-will tour of Cuba, where people have deep affinity for sport; trip is seen as first step toward creating working relationship between leagues of two contries.
lead_paragraph: The trip comes amid some initial efforts by baseball authorities in both countries to create a new reality, one in which Cuban ballplayers might someday come and go freely between their country and the major leagues.

headline.main: M.L.B.’s Good-Will Tour of Cuba Is Hardly the Last Word
headline.print_headline: A Good-Will Tour of Cuba Is Hardly the Last Word

snippet: The trip comes amid some initial efforts by baseball authorities in both countries to create a new reality, one in which Cuban ballplayers might someday come and go freely between their country and the major leagues.
